{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3232428,"name":"Joseph Farkas","username":"MrRedness","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrredness/{size}/229088_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-15T18:11:05.445Z","cooked":"

Hey y’all, I started work last year on a Crash Course to C++ in the context of FRC code to aid in teaching programming. This year I expanded it significantly and polished it, and also added a section dedicated to easing students into using vendor and WPIlib libraries, with an emphasis on pointing them to documentation, so they can slowly learn to be self-sufficient. I like referencing this guide whenever students raise questions to show them where they can find answers on their own. I know most team are using Java, but you might still find it helpful and possibly an inspiration for a similar Java version.

GitHub

Home

A crash course on C++ in the context of robot code. - TEAM1771/Crash-Course

Any and all feedback is greatly appreciated!
